alert.note: Alert for Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:39AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Laurel, west central Owsley, southwestern Estill, central Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle, southwestern Lee and northwestern Clay Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 238 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Danville to 10 miles west of Bee Lick to near Cains Store. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Science Hill, Ottowa, Indian Lakes Park, Quail, Bee Lick, Gum Sulphur, Willailla, Bandy and Level Green around 250 AM EDT. Somerset, Maretburg, Lake Linville, Spiro, Renfro Valley, Hiatt, Wabp, Bromo, Sand Springs and Dabney around 255 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Mount Vernon, Boone, Orlando, Flat Rock, Dudley Station, Muellersville, Hummel, Burr, Bent, Pine Hill, Robinet, Cooksburg, Jep Hill, Donaro, Withers, Johnetta, Horse Lick, Sinks, Gauley, Goochland, Dango, Middlefork, Ardery, Carico, Loam, Cruise, Parrot, Templer, Eberle, Shirley, McKee, Dabolt, Bunch, Shop Branch, Locust Branch, Jinks, Olin, Atkinstown, Deese, Blackburn, London, Irvine, Ravenna, Mildred, Wagersville, Sublimity City, Tyner, Zekes Point, London-Corbin Airport, Herd, Nathanton, Leighton, Levi Jackson S.P., Elian, Maulden, Green Hall, Alumbaugh, Maplesville, Shepherdtown and Cow Creek. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 37 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County near mile marker 17, and between mile markers 20 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
